bibl.title: Letter from Samuel W. Smith to Elihu Root, October 25, 1901

div1.p: Smith requests, on Victor C. Vaughan's behalf, that Root detail Walter Reed to attend a medical conference at Ann Arbor, Michigan in order to present a paper on his work with yellow fever. He encloses a copy of Victor C. Vaughan's letter of October 21, 1901. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from Victor C. Vaughn to Samuel W. Smith, October 21, 1901
div1.opener:
UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN.
----------
DEPARTMENT OF MEDICINE
AND SURGERY,
Ann Arbor, October 21, 1901. 190
Honorable Samuel W. Smith,
Pontiac, Michigan.
Dear Sir:--
div1.p:
On the 21st and 22d of November next, the health
officers of the state of Michigan are to hold a conference at
Ann Arbor. We are exceedingly anxious that Major Walter Reed,
U. S. A., be present with us at that time and give us a paper
embodying his researches on yellow fever. I write to you to
request that you ask the Secretary of War or the Surgeon General
of the Army, or both, to detail Dr. Reed to attend this con-
ference. I may say that Dr. Reed will be pleased to come, should
he receive such a detail. Thanking you in advance, I have the
